programme.title: NFL: America's Game
programme.desc: A look back at Washington Redskins' 1991 Super Bowl victory over Buffalo Bills at the Metrodome in Minneapolis, Minnesota. The Redskins became only the fourth team to win three Super Bowls, while the Bills' loss meant they were now the third team to lose the showpiece encounter twice in succession.(n)

programme.title: NFL: America's Game
programme.desc: The story of Dallas Cowboys' 1992 Super Bowl success over Buffalo Bills at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, California. Dallas claimed their first victory in the showpiece encounter for 15 years with a convincing 52-17 display, their third overall, while the Bills became the first team to lose in this clash three years consecutively.(n)

programme.title: Froch v Groves - The Fight
programme.desc: Carl Froch v George Groves. Another chance to see the bout for the WBA and IBF Super Middleweight titles, held at the Phones 4u Arena in Manchester. Froch avenged one of only two career defeats when outpointing Mikkel Kessler in his previous fight, and his greater experience at the highest level meant he went into this contest as the favourite. However, he could not afford to take Groves lightly, as the man 11 years his junior entered the match with an unblemished professional record.(n)

programme.title: EFL Play-Off Final Highlights: Play Off Finals - Championship 12/13 - Crystal Palace V Watford
programme.desc: Crystal Palace v Watford. Action from the 2012/13 Championship play-off final at Wembley Stadium, as the teams contested a place in the top flight alongside the already promoted Cardiff City and Hull City. Palace reached this match when Wilfried Zaha scored a brace in a 2-0 away win against Brighton & Hove Albion after a goalless draw in the first leg. Meanwhile, Watford bounced back from narrowly missing out on automatic promotion by overcoming Leicester City in dramatic fashion, with Troy Deeney scoring an injury time-winner on the counter after Manuel Almunia had saved a penalty.(n)
